<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FED
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/01/federal-reserve-cuts-rates-first-time-since-2008?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Fed Cut Is the Deepest
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Federal Reserve cut short-term interest rates yesterday for the first time since 2008, ushering in what many expect to be an era of economy-boosting easier money.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/stories/the-fed-believes-in-preventive-monetary-medicine/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called that</a> from a mile away. So what now?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For the worriers, </strong>the NYT <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/31/business/economy/fed-meeting-interest-rates.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">puts it well</a>: The Fed is “vaccinating the economy against risks.” While the stock market has been all gas/no brakes, consumer spending has been strong, and unemployment is at its lowest in a generation...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fed-readies-first-interest-rate-cut-since-2008-11564563601?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">some nagging issues</a> that sent the Fed into the locker room for a quick hammy massage. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The trade war is still a threat to the economy, despite “constructive” talks with China.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Slowing global growth is concerning—especially in Europe, where manufacturing gauges have been flashing red.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For President Trump: </strong>He <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/07/31/business/fed-rate-cut-july-meeting/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">got the rate cut</a> he’s been tweeting about, but it’s not as yuge as he’d hoped. Some critics are whacking the Fed for seemingly caving under White House pressure...even if the cut was technically warranted.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For lending:</strong> Look across the Atlantic for clues. UBS said it’s implementing a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ubs-group-negative/ubs-plans-to-charge-rich-clients-for-swiss-cash-deposits-idUSKCN1UQ26A?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">negative interest rate</a> on wealthy clients who deposit over 2 million Swiss francs with its Swiss bank, citing expectations of a long period of loose monetary policy (aka <em>very </em>low interest rates).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Swiss National Bank kept negative rates at a meeting last month. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The European Central Bank’s deposit rate is currently -0.4%.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And for you: </strong>The Fed’s decision only directly affects borrowing costs for banks, not consumers. But changes will <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/31/your-money/fed-interest-rates.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trickle down</a> to car loans, mortgages, and credit card balances. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the Fed said it'll "act as appropriate" to keep the expansion on track, but Chairman Jerome Powell clarified that this cut was "<span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-07-31/fed-cuts-rates-by-quarter-point-and-signals-potential-for-more?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not the beginning</a> of a long series of rate cuts." When that news reached President Trump, he said "As usual, Powell <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/31/trump-says-fed-chief-powell-let-us-down-by-not-clearly-signaling-more-rate-cuts.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">let us down</a>." </span></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F08%2F01%2Ffederal-reserve-cuts-rates-first-time-since-2008" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=You+called+that+from+a+mile+away.+So+what+now%3F&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/01/federal-reserve-cuts-rates-first-time-since-2008&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CANNABIS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/01/scotts-miracle-gro-shares-hit-record-high?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Scotts Reports Blazing Sales
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New marijuana-friendly laws in Ohio, Michigan, Florida, and Massachusetts aren’t just increasing the number of unintelligible Postmates orders, they’re boosting the fortunes of Scotts Miracle-Gro (+8.61%). The consumer garden supply company’s stock <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-07-31/scotts-jumps-as-stronger-marijuana-sales-spur-improved-outlook?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped</a> to a record high yesterday after it reported: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>18% revenue growth in fiscal Q3, </span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/why-scotts-miracle-gro-stock-194700866.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">easily beating</a></span><span> estimates.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A third consecutive quarter of revenue growth at Scotts’s marijuana-focused subsidiary, Hawthorne Gardening. Sales at the unit more than doubled during the quarter.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Its success isn’t <em>all</em> about pot. Scotts’s tentpole consumer products <a href="https://www.thestreet.com/markets/scotts-miracle-gro-rises-on-strong-third-quarter-earnings-15039792?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">also sold well</a>, and the company negotiated a more favorable deal to distribute Bayer’s Roundup weedkiller. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But Scotts deserves points for foresight. </strong>When it bought a hydroponics supplier in 2015, it became among the first public companies to bet on pot. It’s been a long, strange trip since then. States have taken their sweet, earthy time to legalize marijuana, and the industry didn’t become viable as quickly as the company had hoped. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Told ya. </strong>CEO Jim Hagedorn didn’t miss his chance to spike the ball. “We see today’s results as a validation of the strategy we initially laid out in 2015,” Hagedorn said. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/01/alphabet-cash?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Alphabet's Bathing in Cash
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For a decade, Apple has done cannonballs into the biggest cash pile around. But as <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/332dd974-b349-11e9-8cb2-799a3a8cf37b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the FT reported yesterday</a>, Alphabet has overtaken its Silicon Valley frenemy in the liquidity department.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Apple’s cash pile peaked at $163 billion in 2017. Now it’s $102 billion.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At the same time, Alphabet's holdings have climbed to about $117 billion. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But that’s not necessarily something to be proud of. Investors have <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/alphabet-google-parent-now-has-more-cash-than-apple-2019-7-1028404234?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lost patience</a> with Alphabet for not putting the cash toward stock buybacks or dividends. Apple has spent $122 billion doing just that in the last 18 months, while Alphabet averages $1.7 billion/quarter. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not like Alphabet isn’t trying to spend.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s buying so much real estate in NYC, you’ll soon be flying out of LaGoogle Intl. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Alphabet siphons profits from search advertising into moonshots like internet balloons and salt-based energy storage. Alphabet has lost $15 billion on those “Other Bets” in the six years since it started breaking out the unit’s financials.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And last week, Alphabet pledged another $25 billion for its stock buyback program. It’s now greenlighted $37.5 billion in repurchases year-to-date.</span></li>
</ul>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/01/roundup-news-around-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Earth May Be Flat, but It's Got a Lot of News
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The first stop on our trip around the world is Shenzhen, where earlier this week the NBA <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/nba-renews-china-streaming-deal-tencent-1227543?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">re-upped</a> its streaming deal with Chinese internet services conglomerate Tencent. The deal includes both live and on-demand video. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>An almost inconceivable number of people in China watch NBA programming: 490 million tuned in on Tencent’s platforms last season. The entire U.S. population is ~330 million. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now re-board the Brew Gulfstream and head west to Saudi Arabia, which is making progress in gender parity. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>23% of Saudi women are </span><span><a href="https://qz.com/work/1676120/glowork-helps-women-in-saudi-arabia-enter-the-workforce/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosfutureofwork&stream=future&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">now in the workforce</a></span><span>, up from 18% in 2010 but way behind the global average of 48%. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A big part of that uptick? </span><span><a href="https://www.glowork.net/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Glowork</a></span><span>, a recruiting company founded by a former KPMG exec that works with the government to help women find jobs. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Finally, hop across the Red Sea to Ethiopia, where the government said over 350 million trees <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/30/world/africa/ethiopia-tree-planting-deforestation.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were planted</a> in 12 hours on Monday. That sets a record for a one-day tree-planting spree. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The prime minister, Abiy Ahmed, hopes to eventually plant 4 billion to combat deforestation, improve farmers’ incomes, and tackle climate change.</span></li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/01/locast-sued-major-networks-copyright-issue?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Careful What You Wish For
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1564604912.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/31/business/locast-streaming-free-network-tv.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a> headline from January</sup></em><sup class="sub-text"></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...you just might get it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, CBS, ABC, NBC, and Fox sued to shut down free <a href="https://www.sfgate.com/news/texas/article/Networks-sue-Locast-a-service-that-streams-TV-14269832.php?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TV streaming service</a> Locast in federal court, alleging it violates copyright law. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Locast was founded last year as a nonprofit by former Dish Network exec and lobbyist David Goodfriend. He <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/31/business/locast-streaming-free-network-tv.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">threw a grenade</a> on the TV business by transmitting signals to the Locast service, where people could watch for free, without permission.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Locast </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/networks-sue-to-stop-streaming-service-offering-free-tv-feeds-11564584062?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">argues</a></span><span> that's a-okay thanks to a legal exemption from copyright laws for noncommercial entities servicing local jurisdictions.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But the big broadcasters disagree.</strong> They say the law applies to Locast because a) it isn’t <em>truly</em> local and b) it has not-so-noncommercial beginnings—Locast got $500,000 in donations from AT&T earlier this year, for example. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Pay-TV players (like Dish and AT&T) prefer Locast’s model over what they consider unfair distribution fees broadcasters charge. But <a href="https://www.axios.com/locast-att-cbs-fox-broadcast-streaming-lawsuit-bd592a6c-b846-48bc-b685-eb0da9ac24f5.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the networks</a>, facing an existential threat to their fee structures, say Goodfriend is less Robin Hood, more IP thief.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nFED\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Fed Cut Is the Deepest\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Federal Reserve cut short-term interest rates yesterday for the first time since 2008, ushering in what many expect to be an era of economy-boosting easier money.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/stories/the-fed-believes-in-preventive-monetary-medicine/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled that\u003c/a\u003e from a mile away. So what now?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor the worriers, \u003c/strong\u003ethe NYT \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/31/business/economy/fed-meeting-interest-rates.html?action=click\u0026amp;module=Top%20Stories\u0026amp;pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eputs it well\u003c/a\u003e: The Fed is “vaccinating the economy against risks.” While the stock market has been all gas/no brakes, consumer spending has been strong, and unemployment is at its lowest in a generation...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere are \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/fed-readies-first-interest-rate-cut-since-2008-11564563601?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esome nagging issues\u003c/a\u003e that sent the Fed into the locker room for a quick hammy massage. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe trade war is still a threat to the economy, despite “constructive” talks with China.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSlowing global growth is concerning—especially in Europe, where manufacturing gauges have been flashing red.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor President Trump: \u003c/strong\u003eHe \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/07/31/business/fed-rate-cut-july-meeting/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egot the rate cut\u003c/a\u003e he’s been tweeting about, but it’s not as yuge as he’d hoped. Some critics are whacking the Fed for seemingly caving under White House pressure...even if the cut was technically warranted.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor lending:\u003c/strong\u003e Look across the Atlantic for clues. UBS said it’s implementing a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ubs-group-negative/ubs-plans-to-charge-rich-clients-for-swiss-cash-deposits-idUSKCN1UQ26A?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enegative interest rate\u003c/a\u003e on wealthy clients who deposit over 2 million Swiss francs with its Swiss bank, citing expectations of a long period of loose monetary policy (aka \u003cem\u003every \u003c/em\u003elow interest rates).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Swiss National Bank kept negative rates at a meeting last month. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe European Central Bank’s deposit rate is currently -0.4%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd for you: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Fed’s decision only directly affects borrowing costs for banks, not consumers. But changes will \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/31/your-money/fed-interest-rates.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etrickle down\u003c/a\u003e to car loans, mortgages, and credit card balances. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe Fed said it'll \"act as appropriate\" to keep the expansion on track, but Chairman Jerome Powell clarified that this cut was \"\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-07-31/fed-cuts-rates-by-quarter-point-and-signals-potential-for-more?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot the beginning\u003c/a\u003e of a long series of rate cuts.\" When that news reached President Trump, he said \"As usual, Powell \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/31/trump-says-fed-chief-powell-let-us-down-by-not-clearly-signaling-more-rate-cuts.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elet us down\u003c/a\u003e.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew marijuana-friendly laws in Ohio, Michigan, Florida, and Massachusetts aren’t just increasing the number of unintelligible Postmates orders, they’re boosting the fortunes of Scotts Miracle-Gro (+8.61%). The consumer garden supply company’s stock \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-07-31/scotts-jumps-as-stronger-marijuana-sales-spur-improved-outlook?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejumped\u003c/a\u003e to a record high yesterday after it reported: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e18% revenue growth in fiscal Q3, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/why-scotts-miracle-gro-stock-194700866.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeasily beating\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e estimates.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA third consecutive quarter of revenue growth at Scotts’s marijuana-focused subsidiary, Hawthorne Gardening. Sales at the unit more than doubled during the quarter.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIts success isn’t \u003cem\u003eall\u003c/em\u003e about pot. Scotts’s tentpole consumer products \u003ca href=\"https://www.thestreet.com/markets/scotts-miracle-gro-rises-on-strong-third-quarter-earnings-15039792?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealso sold well\u003c/a\u003e, and the company negotiated a more favorable deal to distribute Bayer’s Roundup weedkiller. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut Scotts deserves points for foresight. \u003c/strong\u003eWhen it bought a hydroponics supplier in 2015, it became among the first public companies to bet on pot. It’s been a long, strange trip since then. States have taken their sweet, earthy time to legalize marijuana, and the industry didn’t become viable as quickly as the company had hoped. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTold ya. \u003c/strong\u003eCEO Jim Hagedorn didn’t miss his chance to spike the ball. “We see style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor a decade, Apple has done cannonballs into the biggest cash pile around. But as \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/332dd974-b349-11e9-8cb2-799a3a8cf37b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe FT reported yesterday\u003c/a\u003e, Alphabet has overtaken its Silicon Valley frenemy in the liquidity department.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eApple’s cash pile peaked at $163 billion in 2017. Now it’s $102 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt the same time, Alphabet's holdings have climbed to about $117 billion. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut that’s not necessarily something to be proud of. Investors have \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/alphabet-google-parent-now-has-more-cash-than-apple-2019-7-1028404234?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elost patience\u003c/a\u003e with Alphabet for not putting the cash toward stock buybacks or dividends. Apple has spent $122 billion doing just that in the last 18 months, while Alphabet averages $1.7 billion/quarter. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s not like Alphabet isn’t trying to spend.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s buying so much real estate in NYC, you’ll soon be flying out of LaGoogle Intl. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAlphabet siphons profits from search advertising into moonshots like internet balloons and salt-based energy storage. Alphabet has lost $15 billion on those “Other Bets” in the six years since it started breaking out the unit’s financials.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd last week, Alphabet pledged another $25 billion for its stock buyback program. It’s now greenlighted $37.5 billion in repurchases year-to-date.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Earth May Be Flat, but It's Got a Lot of News\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe first stop on our trip around the world is Shenzhen, where earlier this week the NBA \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/nba-renews-china-streaming-deal-tencent-1227543?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ere-upped\u003c/a\u003e its streaming deal with Chinese internet services conglomerate Tencent. The deal includes both live and on-demand video. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAn almost inconceivable number of people in China watch NBA programming: 490 million tuned in on Tencent’s platforms last season. The entire U.S. population is ~330 million. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow re-board the Brew Gulfstream and head west to Saudi Arabia, which is making progress in gender parity. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e23% of Saudi women are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/work/1676120/glowork-helps-women-in-saudi-arabia-enter-the-workforce/?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosfutureofwork\u0026stream=future\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enow in the workforce\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, up from 18% in 2010 but way behind the global average of 48%. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA big part of that uptick? \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.glowork.net/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eGlowork\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a recruiting company founded by a former KPMG exec that works with the government to help women find jobs. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFinally, hop across the Red Sea to Ethiopia, where the government said over 350 million trees \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/30/world/africa/ethiopia-tree-planting-deforestation.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere planted\u003c/a\u003e in 12 hours on Monday. That sets a record for a one-day tree-planting spree. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe prime minister, Abiy Ahmed, hopes to eventually plant 4 billion to combat deforestation, improve farmers’ incomes, and tackle climate change.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/31/business/locast-streaming-free-network-tv.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNew York Times\u003c/a\u003e headline from January\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003csup class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...you just might get it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, CBS, ABC, NBC, and Fox sued to shut down free \u003ca href=\"https://www.sfgate.com/news/texas/article/Networks-sue-Locast-a-service-that-streams-TV-14269832.php?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTV streaming service\u003c/a\u003e Locast in federal court, alleging it violates copyright law. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eLocast was founded last year as a nonprofit by former Dish Network exec and lobbyist David Goodfriend. He \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/31/business/locast-streaming-free-network-tv.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethrew a grenade\u003c/a\u003e on the TV business by transmitting signals to the Locast service, where people could watch for free, without permission.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLocast \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/networks-sue-to-stop-streaming-service-offering-free-tv-feeds-11564584062?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eargues\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that's a-okay thanks to a legal exemption from copyright laws for noncommercial entities servicing local jurisdictions.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut the big broadcasters disagree.\u003c/strong\u003e They say the law applies to Locast because a) it isn’t \u003cem\u003etruly\u003c/em\u003e local and b) it has not-so-noncommercial beginnings—Locast got $500,000 in donations from AT\u0026T earlier this year, for example. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003ePay-TV players (like Dish and AT\u0026T) prefer Locast’s model over what they consider unfair distribution fees broadcasters charge. But \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/locast-att-cbs-fox-broadcast-streaming-lawsuit-bd592a6c-b846-48bc-b685-eb0da9ac24f5.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe networks\u003c/a\u003e, facing an existential threat to their fee structures, say Goodfriend is less Robin Hood, more IP thief.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:
